entry.title: Vim-pencil for Soft Line Breaks
entry.content:
So I mentioned in a previous post that I wasn’t happy with the way that word wrapping was working in VIM for me. I’ve found a VIM plugin that manages the whole thing a lot easier, called VIM-pencil, which adds word-wrapping in a decidedly more sensible way. Mainly it does both hard and soft wraps without messing up the formatting of a post.

Thanks to YADR my environment is now looking very nice indeed.

entry.title: Adding Plugins to Yadr
entry.content:
So I installed yadr some time ago, but lo and behold I’d completely forgotten how to add plugins to vim. I knew it used vundle to handle plugins, but I wasn’t sure if there was a syntax they preferred.

Oh hey look, there is!

From this handy readme page on github:

yav -u https://github.com/airblade/vim-rooter

This automatically runs vundle’s :PluginInstall command to stick all the plugin gubbinz in their appropriate locations.

entry.title: The Second Post
entry.content:
This is the second post

I’m going to think about headings a bit better this time. Fewer h1’s = better. Octopress seems really very easy to mess about with, certainly more so than Wordpress. To re-order my menu (and add the about page) all I had to do was add some lines to the sources/_includes/custom/navigation file.

I need a better solution for editing markdown though. VIM ends up scrolling too much with prose. I saw some neat plugins for writing prose in vim though, maybe I’ll check those out.
